dialogue_content.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: I'd love to hear about the storm rescue you were involved in.

dialogue_content.original_text: It was back in '73, I believe.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject

dialogue_content.original_text: The storm came out of nowhere, and we got the call that a fishing boat was in trouble.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: It sounds like the storm rescue left a significant impression on you. What was going through your mind as you approached the boat?

dialogue_content.original_text: I could see the boat struggling against the waves, and all I could think about was getting everyone back safely.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject

dialogue_content.original_text: It was an intense experience, but there was also this incredible sense of responsibility and camaraderie with my crew.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: That must have been an incredible experience. How did that day shape your career in the Coast Guard?

dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
dialogue_content.original_text: It really did. You know, after that rescue, I realized the impact we could have. It wasn't just about the thrill; it was about saving lives. It instilled a sense of purpose in me, and I knew I wanted to continue making a difference. The camaraderie with the crew also strengthened, and that bond carried us through many more challenging situations.

dialogue_content.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: It sounds like that day had a profound impact on you. What were some of the challenges you faced during the oil spill cleanup?

dialogue_content.original_text: Oh, the oil spill was a whole different beast.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject

dialogue_content.original_text: It was a few years after the storm rescue, around '76.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject

dialogue_content.original_text: I had this overwhelming sadness seeing the wildlife struggling and knowing how the environment was suffering.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: That sounds incredibly challenging. So when did things change after the oil spill cleanup?

dialogue_content.original_text: It was around the late '70s when I started considering what was next for me.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject

dialogue_content.original_text: That's when I moved to the lake.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: I'd love to hear more about the oil spill cleanup and how it affected you personally.

dialogue_content.original_text: Seeing the oil cover everything was just heartbreaking.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject

dialogue_content.original_text: There was a moment when I saw a bird struggling in the oil, and it just hit me hard.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: It's clear that the oil spill had a profound impact on you. How did you cope with the emotional toll it took?

dialogue_content.original_text: I found solace in talking with my fellow team members.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: So after everything you've been through, tell me about your life by the lake now.

dialogue_content.original_text: Living by the lake has been a blessing in many ways.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject

dialogue_content.original_text: It's such a contrast to the chaos of my days in the Coast Guard.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject

dialogue_content.original_text: I spend my days fishing, reading, and just enjoying the quiet.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: Before we finish, Tom, what would you say is the biggest lesson you've learned from your journey?

dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
dialogue_content.original_text: I think, looking back, the most important lesson I've learned is resilience. Life throws you into storms, both literal and metaphorical. It's about finding the strength to face them, but also knowing when to step back and seek peace. Living by the lake has shown me the beauty of stillness and reflection. Itâ€™s all part of the journey, and I'm grateful for every step.
